revised_title: Photometric Intensity of Coronal Light During the Solar Eclipse of August 28-29, 1886
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the photometric intensity of the coronal light during the solar eclipse of August 28-29, 1886. They used a telescope and a photometric box to compare the intensity of the coronal light with a glow lamp. The results showed that the light of the corona was apparently equal to 0.42 of a standard candle at a distance of 1 foot. This study helped improve the understanding of the intensity and color of the coronal light during solar eclipses.
